alert.note: Alert for Hickman; Humphreys; Lewis; Maury; Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 12:51PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Hickman, southeastern Humphreys, eastern Lewis, Maury and far northeast Perry. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1249 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms continuing to move across the area. Radar estimated up to 3 inches of rain have fallen so far today. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Hohenwald, Centerville, Mount Pleasant, Hurricane Mills, Hampshire, Gordonsburg, Williamsport, Primm Springs, Kimmins, Nunnelly, Santa Fe, Pinewood, Bucksnort and Culleoka. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
